title: INDEX_OF_IGNORE_CASE
description: Returns the starting position (zero-based index) of the first occurrence of substring within string, ignoring case differences. If index_optional is provided, the search begins at the specified index. Returns -1 if the substring is not found.

parameters.name: index_optional
parameters.description: The zero-based index at which to start the search. Defaults to 0 if omitted.

examples:
INDEX_OF("hello world", "hello")
-- Returns 0
-- Note: The index is based on a 0-based index (the first character is at position 0).

INDEX_OF_IGNORE_CASE("hello world", "Hello")
-- Returns 0 because the substring "Hello" (case-insensitive match) starts at the 6th position in the string.
-- Note: The index is based on a 0-based index (the first character is at position 0).

INDEX_OF_IGNORE_CASE("world world", "Hello")
-- Returns -1
-- Note: The index is based on a 0-based index (the first character is at position 0).

INDEX_OF_IGNORE_CASE("hello world", "o", 5)
-- Returns 7 because the first occurrence of "o" (case-insensitive match) starting from index 5 is at position 7.
-- Note: The start position and result use a 0-based index.
